page.title: 11BENBAIN-2
page.content:
In the old days the cattle were stabled in the byre next to the living area with just a door between. There was no inside toilet until recently, just an earth closet near the stream at the back of the house. The neighbouring farmer can still remember seeing that toilet when he was a boy. His father used to own our house.
It can be very cold in winter and our water supply sometimes freezes up. Ours is a private water pipe from a collecting tank on the hill behind us which is fed from a spring. We get a lot of snow, often more than a metre deep. Then we have to walk to the road to meet our school taxi as we cannot get our car along the track from our house.
